intro: Zieria cephalophila, commonly known as the slender zieria, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its small, evergreen leaves and clusters of white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as heathlands and forest floors. It has a compact growth habit and is often found in coastal regions. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and threatened species.
